definition: YMCA (international Christian youth movement, formed in 1844)
abbr. for 青海[Qing1 hai3], Qinghai Province
can/to be possible/to be able to/will/to be likely to/to be sure to/to assemble/to meet/to gather/to see/union/group/association/CL:個|个[ge4]/a moment (Taiwan pr. for this sense is [hui3])

sentences.english: Maybe, though I doubt many actual ska rockers went to see “A Chorus Line.”
sentences.chinese: 我嚴重懷疑搖滾青年會去百老匯看錶演嗎？

sentences.english: I began to get interested in YMCA work.
sentences.chinese: 我開始對基督教青年會的工作產生興趣了。

sentences.english: Many gyms, community centers, and YMCAs offer yoga classes.
sentences.chinese: 很多體育館，社區，基督教青年會都開設瑜伽課程。

sentences.english: See if your area has a YMCA.
sentences.chinese: 觀察你附近的區域是否有基督教青年會。

sentences.english: I think about China during Wes's swimming lessons at the YMCA.
sentences.chinese: 維斯在基督教青年會學游泳的時候我想到了中國。

sentences.english: You can find classes at your local YMCA, too.
sentences.chinese: 你也可以在當地的基督教青年會找到這樣的課程。

sentences.english: I work at the YMCA with kids.
sentences.chinese: 我在基督教青年會教小朋友。

sentences.english: Jack used to see Marvin playing handball at the Y.
sentences.chinese: 傑克過去總是在基督教青年會觀看馬文打手球。

sentences.english: This song is specially written for Dharma Drum Youth.
sentences.chinese: 特別爲法鼓山青年會所創作。

sentences.english: Excuse me, sir. Could you tell me how to get to the YWCA building?
sentences.chinese: 對不起，先生，你可以告訴我怎樣去女青年會嗎？

definition: person from the same village, town, or province
fellow countryman (from the same village)/local people/villager/the folks back home
to express in words or writing/to make a speech (esp. short introduction, vote of thanks, afterword, funeral homily etc)/to address (an audience)/same as 致詞|致词
